solution_line_template: After one year he earns $200 in interest because {initial_deposit} x {first_year_interest_rate} = <<{initial_deposit}*{first_year_interest_rate}={first_year_interest}>>{first_year_interest}
After one year it has $1,200 in the account because {initial_deposit} + {first_year_interest} = <<{initial_deposit}+{first_year_interest}={after_first_year}>>{after_first_year}
After this it has $600 in it because {after_first_year} - {withdrawal_amount} = <<{after_first_year}-{withdrawal_amount}={after_withdrawal}>>{after_withdrawal}
She earns $90 in interest because {after_withdrawal} x {second_year_interest_rate} = <<{after_withdrawal}*{second_year_interest_rate}={second_year_interest}>>{second_year_interest}
